title: Magnetic flux - direction of mag field changes th

content.prompt: A uniform magnetic field of magnitude B is directed an angle θ from the +y-axis. The magnetic field passes through a rectangle in the xz-plane, as shown. The angle θ is slowly increased over time. Which of the following changes could result in the flux through the rectangle remaining constant over time, and provides correct justification?

choices.label: Decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing θ increases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the plane of the rectangle, while decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field decreases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the rectangle.

Decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing θ increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rectangle, while decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field decreases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

Increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing θ decreases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the plane of the rectangle, while increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

Increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing θ decreases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rectangle, while increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
